content:
Looking for some feedback on our WIP implementation guide for clinical research data. Comments welcome!

https://github.com/esource-consortium/fhir-clinical-research
do you have it published somewhere? digging through the source in github is not as nice...

It's not published anywhere, as I got lost in a rabbit hole of tooling there and wanted to focus on the content. If there is something free I can hook into a GitHub webhook that will auto publish, I will gladly set it up...
You can throw the md files up on http://simplifier.net/ and you'll get a nice url and html pages out of it
It's kind of 'loose' - I'd much rather see a proper rendered profile, that would resolve ambiguity around it

paging @Hugh Glover - the Transcelerate eSource Group (enabled by the BR&R) are also working on a Research related IG (principally for Lab results) - ultimately BR&R would be the 'sponsor' for a Clinical Research Implementation Guide so should be key stakeholder. Who are the eSource Consortium? Worth cross-posting in #research as well

I missed a few messages here - I'd like to clarify that "sponsor" as defined in the linked IG means clinical trial sponsor (https://www.cancer.gov/publications/dictionaries/cancer-terms/def/clinical-trial-sponsor), not an "owner organization" of the guide.

see https://github.com/hl7-fhir/auto-ig-builder/blob/master/README.md

Thanks I will take a look at this. It seems straightforward...

the IG would probably be sponsored by the Biomedical Research and Regulatory (BR&R) working group, I am interested in knowing what the eSource consortium is and what its relationship with the BR&R WG is.
